criteria.description: AST-based validator checks syntax and exact signature (name, params, return type) before scoring.
criteria.justification: Uses ast.parse to validate syntax and an AST check for name and positional arg names, but ignores return type and type annotations, so not an exact signature match.

criteria.description: Reward structure differentiates between syntax errors, signature mismatches, logic failures, and full success.
criteria.justification: Reward combines pass_rate with bonuses for syntax_ok and signature_ok; syntax and signature mismatches reduce reward, and full success yields higher reward.

criteria.description: Automatic unit tests or assertions run per prompt, feeding pass/fail results into rewards.
criteria.justification: Runs golden implementation comparisons across test cases per problem and uses the pass rate directly in the reward.

criteria.description: Environment enforces docstring/type hint requirements when specified, with clear penalties when missing.
criteria.justification: Prompts request a docstring and type hints, but the validator does not check for a docstring or type hints and applies no explicit penalties for missing them.

criteria.description: Metadata captures `syntax_ok`, `signature_ok`, `tests_passed`, and error messages to aid analysis.
criteria.justification: Metrics include syntax_ok, signature_ok, tests_passed/total, pass_rate, and runtime_error; metadata records an error_message, response sizes, and task identifiers.

notes: Cleaner AST validation exists for name/arg order, but return/type annotation enforcement and docstring checks are absent. Reward shaping is smooth with pass_rate and bonuses; length penalty is minor. Good metadata coverage (including runtime_error and size metrics).
